paragraphs.content: Chapter 8
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 8

paragraphs.content: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,

paragraphs.content: How long wilt thou speak these things? and how long shall the words of thy mouth be like a strong wind?
paragraphs.contentHtml: How long wilt thou speak these things? and how long shall the words of thy mouth be like a strong wind?

paragraphs.content: Doth God pervert judgment? or doth the Almighty pervert justice?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Doth God pervert judgment? or doth the Almighty pervert justice?

paragraphs.content: If thy children have sinned against him, and he have cast them away for their transgression;
paragraphs.contentHtml: If thy children have sinned against him, and he have cast them away for their transgression;

paragraphs.content: If thou wouldest seek unto God betimes, and make thy supplication to the Almighty;
paragraphs.contentHtml: If thou wouldest seek unto God betimes, and make thy supplication to the Almighty;

paragraphs.content: If thou wert pure and upright; surely now he would awake for thee, and make the habitation of thy righteousness prosperous.
paragraphs.contentHtml: If thou wert pure and upright; surely now he would awake for thee, and make the habitation of thy righteousness prosperous.

paragraphs.content: Though thy beginning was small, yet thy latter end should greatly increase.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Though thy beginning was small, yet thy latter end should greatly increase.

paragraphs.content: For inquire, I pray thee, of the former age, and prepare thyself to the search of their fathers:
paragraphs.contentHtml: For inquire, I pray thee, of the former age, and prepare thyself to the search of their fathers:

paragraphs.content: (For we are but of yesterday, and know nothing, because our days upon earth are a shadow:)
paragraphs.contentHtml: (For we are but of yesterday, and know nothing, because our days upon earth are a shadow:)

paragraphs.content: Shall not they teach thee, and tell thee, and utter words out of their heart?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Shall not they teach thee, and tell thee, and utter words out of their heart?

paragraphs.content: Can the rush grow up without mire? can the flag grow without water?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Can the rush grow up without mire? can the flag grow without water?

paragraphs.content: Whilst it is yet in his greenness, and not cut down, it withereth before any other herb.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whilst it is yet in his greenness, and not cut down, it withereth before any other herb.

paragraphs.content: So are the paths of all that forget God; and the hypocrite’s hope shall perish:
paragraphs.contentHtml: So are the paths of all that forget God; and the hypocrite’s hope shall perish:

paragraphs.content: Whose hope shall be cut off, and whose trust shall be a spider’s web.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whose hope shall be cut off, and whose trust shall be a spider’s web.

paragraphs.content: He shall lean upon his house, but it shall not stand: he shall hold it fast, but it shall not endure.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He shall lean upon his house, but it shall not stand: he shall hold it fast, but it shall not endure.

paragraphs.content: He is green before the sun, and his branch shooteth forth in his garden.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He is green before the sun, and his branch shooteth forth in his garden.

paragraphs.content: His roots are wrapped about the heap, and seeth the place of stones.
paragraphs.contentHtml: His roots are wrapped about the heap, and seeth the place of stones.

paragraphs.content: If he destroy him from his place, then it shall deny him, saying, I have not seen thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: If he destroy him from his place, then it shall deny him, saying, I have not seen thee.

paragraphs.content: Behold, this is the joy of his way, and out of the earth shall others grow.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, this is the joy of his way, and out of the earth shall others grow.

paragraphs.content: Behold, God will not cast away a perfect man, neither will he help the evil doers:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, God will not cast away a perfect man, neither will he help the evil doers:

paragraphs.content: Till he fill thy mouth with laughing, and thy lips with rejoicing.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Till he fill thy mouth with laughing, and thy lips with rejoicing.

paragraphs.content: They that hate thee shall be clothed with shame; and the dwelling place of the wicked shall come to nought.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They that hate thee shall be clothed with shame; and the dwelling place of the wicked shall come to nought.
